author: Adam Woodward
title: First baby flamingoes of the year at Bioparc « Euro Weekly News
text: Following 3 months in incubation, Bioparc Fuengirola welcomes of the first flamingo babies of the year. The park’s Zoology team expects there to be around a dozen births in total. If so, that would make a total of about 70 flamingoes in the park, including rose and dwarf species. Visitors to Bioparc Fuengirola will be able to spot these small chicks with grayish fluffy down among the feathers of their parents or exploring the beach with the adult flamingos that live in the park. Throughout the incubation period, the professionals at the park try to respect the natural processes of the flamingo colony. The correct and most appropriate humidity must be maintained as much as the salinity levels of the water for the eggs to survive, and the cleaning of the facility is minimised so as not to create stress in the flamingo colony. For now, the chicks will stay in the nest for three to four days, in some cases even a week. When the time comes to leave it, they will begin an exploration route through the flamingo colony and can be observed forming small nurseries watched over by the adults. A true wonder of nature. Bioparc is open from 10am to 11pm every day and ticket prices range from €21 to €28. Thank you for taking the time to read this article. Do remember to come back and check The Euro Weekly News website for all your up-to-date local and international news stories and remember, you can also follow us on Facebook and Instagram. author: Psychreg News Team
title: This “Igloo Sleep Method” Is a Cost-Effective Way to Keep Warm This Winter
text:
This week, the Met Office issued a cold weather warning, with bracing temperatures as low as –10 °C set to hit the UK.
With temperatures predicted to be even lower than Greenland in some parts of the UK,
Bensons for Beds has revealed why taking inspiration from such colder climes may be the solution to keeping your bedroom warm on a budget this week.
Residing in certain areas of Canada, Greenland, and the Arctic, the Inuits have a method of keeping warm that has worked for thousands of years: igloos. Inside the igloo, there’s a high platform on which the inhabitants sleep. As heat rises, it makes sense to sleep on a high platform.
Bensons for Beds brand manager, Rachel Marshall, says: “We can gain inspiration from some of the strategies to keep our houses warm, such as sleeping higher up. As heated air is thinner than colder air, it makes sense that it naturally rises. Therefore, kids sleeping on top of a bunk bed or in a high or
midsleeper bed could feel the benefits.
Surprisingly, there is also a hole or vent in the igloo, which is needed to allow fresh air in and the water vapour caused by breathing out. The vent helps the interior remain dry. This same logic should be applied to the vents in your home.
Rachel adds: “It may be tempting to close any vents leading to the outside of your home but it’s important not to do this.
“Air vents are in your home for a reason. They’ve been designed to allow air to flow through your home and also to prevent a buildup of humidity. Excess humidity can lead to mould, which then can lead to health problems that affect our sleep.”
Research suggests that
mould in the bedroom can lead to a host of sleep issues, such as insomnia and snoring, while allergic rhinitis can also lead to restlessness and even sleep apnea.
The key behind igloos is insulation so focus on creating a cosy, well-insulated environment in your bedroom without having to turn the heating up. One cost-effective solution is to invest in an all-season duvet. Products such as the
Slumberland 3-in-1 duvet contain a 4.5 tog for warmer nights, a 9 tog for cooler nights, or can be combined to create a 13.5 tog for the coldest of nights.
Rachel concludes: “Use curtains to your advantage by keeping them open during the day to let the sun provide natural warmth before closing them at night to insulate the room. Block out any pesky draughts with cost-effective draft stoppers made from towels or bundled up socks.”
For more tips on
keeping warm on a budget, visit the Bensons for Beds Sleep Hub.

author: 网易
title: 保研女生侮辱四川后续："底裤"被扒不简单，学校处罚下达惹众怒|方言|财大|四川人|四川省|学业奖学金_网易订阅
text:
学历真不能和素质划等号！
西南财大的保送研究生，成绩优秀还是入党积极分子，明面上光彩照人。
然而，真面目却令人咋舌，不仅公然侮辱四川人长相方言，还拿汶川地震开玩笑。
事件曝光之后，学校处理结果出炉，网友却怒斥：这还能忍……
世界上没有十全十美的地方，即便是北京上海这种超级大都市，也不能让所有人满意。
然而，当一个人侮辱全部当地人的时候，这种事恐怕也没人能忍。
就在这两天，成都一高校一名女学生，被曝出侮辱当地。
据说，这名女生表现相当不错，在别人面前是一个好学生，学习好关系处理得也不错。
大学毕业顺利保送研究生，本来想去北京，可惜没有北京的学校接收，于是就来了西南财经政法大学。
按理来说，西南财大作为国内双一流高校，即便是比不上北大清华，也是国内名列前茅的顶尖高校。
然而，在这名女生眼里，却哪哪都看不上西南财大。
调侃当地人的长相，说长得和原始人一样，怪不得整容发达，不整整都没法看。
还说这里人说的方言，土得要命，见了就想扇巴掌的那种。
方言方言，哪里没有方言，见过之前就连普通话也是北京的方言。
国内是这样国外也是一样，美国英国都是英语国家，可是说的英语却还不一样。
就连英国美国国内，也有好几种口音，这基本上都已经是世界公认的常识。
可在这位女生嘴里，方言就是土，不说普通话就是土，真是像地域歧视，总有一百种理由。
而最严重，也最让当地人乃至全网网友都生气的，还是她对四川大地震的调侃。
众所周知，四川处于地震带上，常年都有地震，就在6月25日，四川宜宾还发生一起4.5级大地震。
地震是天灾不是人祸，是谁都不愿意看到，也不希望发生的事情。
可是，在这名女生的嘴里，却成了活该。
直接拿四川大地震对四川人开嘲，嘲讽别人个子矮是因为地震时被土卖了半截身子。
四川方言吐字不清是因为被土灌进了嗓子，然后说话就含糊不清。
说自己在这里呆了一段时间不舒服，想要趁放假回家休息休息，然后学校课程紧张，没时间回去。
这位就说这里早就被卖了，全都不是活人了，所以阴气重她待着不舒服。
话说到最后的时候，这位女生甚至说要去泰国买古曼童，咒这里天天7.0级大地震。
古曼童是什么东西，基本上经常上网的人都知道，泰国一种很邪恶的民间邪物。
据说国内有不少女明星请过这些东西，说白了就是国内民间流传的所谓的养小鬼。
而这些看起来已经十分严重的话，却还不是这位女生说的全部，只是被媒体截出来的一部分。
除了这些以外，嘲讽本地人长相身高的，嘲讽成都一些人性取向的，什么都有。
可以说，知道的不知道，能想到的想不到的，这位女生全都说出来了。
好好的一名西南财大研究生，本来可以说是前途无量，现在却因为一句话直接得罪了全四川人。
有网友也扒出了这名女生的真实身份，据说姓白东北辽宁人，学的是会计是据分析方向。
今年也是研一，入学没多长时间，甚至连真实照片和身份证的后三位都被发在了当地的论坛上。
看着长相，网友们也不客气了，蛇精脸、土气什么词都用上了。
不过也真不能怪网友，这人从长相来看，确实很符合她自己说的话。
只说当地人长得土气，自己长得看起来也不咋地。
事情曝光之后，也迅速引起了网友们的热议，毕竟是在四川上的研究生，还直接对本地人开地图炮。
可以说，这几句话说出来，直接得罪了全校一半以上的师生，和外面大部分本地人。
网友们暴怒的同时，学校也迅速做出了反应，不过反映措施却让大部分人都觉得不痛不痒。
首先是取消入党积极分子资格，也就是说，至少在校期间想要入党，不说绝无可能，但也没那么容易了。
其次就是留校察看一年时间，期间如果有什么违纪那再开除。
这种处罚措施，按照网友们的说法来说，中规中矩不痛不痒。
如果事情没有闹大，仅局限在小范围学校内的话，那称得上是比较严重。
可现在，这件事情别说四川人了，河南人都知道了，已经不算是小事情了，却还是这样处理。
不少网友的态度就是必须从严处理，毕竟身为大学生，也是成年人了，知道什么话该说什么不该说。
有些时候，哪怕是心里有气也不能算在无辜人的头上，如果真的看不上四川，为什么不退学再考？
换句话说，这种人就是既要又要，明知自己没能力考上北京的高校，就把怨气发泄在当地头上。
还拿最让当地人悲伤的事情说事，把刀往伤口上插！
那么，大家是怎么看待这件事情呢？欢迎留言讨论……
参考信息源：
官方媒体：法治进行时 2025-06-25《四川高校一学生发表有关地震不当言论 歧视当地人长相和方言等 学校：取消入党积极分子资格 留校察看一年（郭）》
但为提升文章可读性，细节可能存在润色，请理智阅读，仅供参考！
声明：个人原创，仅供参考

author: DOL - Diário Online
title: PROERD forma mais de 600 alunos e combate violência e drogas
text:
O Programa Educacional de Resistência às Drogas e à Violência (PROERD) celebrou a formatura de 643 alunos em Marabá, reunindo estudantes do 5º ao 7º ano de diversas escolas. Durante o ciclo de atividades, as crianças aprenderam sobre a importância de resistir ao uso de drogas e como combater a violência.
Gilda Rios, diretora do Colégio com Supervisão Militar (CMRio), compartilhou a importância do PROERD, que, este ano, atendeu 7 mil alunos. "É um combate à prevenção às drogas e à violência", destacou. O programa não só impacta os alunos, mas também suas famílias e comunidades.
A diretora enfatizou que os estudantes aprendem comportamentos preventivos que os ajudam a se proteger da violência e a rejeitar as drogas em qualquer ambiente, seja na escola, praça ou clube. "É uma preparação para a vida", concluiu.
Veja também:
[Câmara autoriza pensão vitalícia para afetados pelo Zika](https://dol.com.br/carajas/noticias/brasil/885529/camara-autoriza-pensao-vitalicia-para-afetados-pelo-zika?d=1)[Colorindo suas férias: arte e diversão em Canaã dos Carajás](https://dol.com.br/carajas/cidades/canaa-dos-carajas/885513/colorindo-suas-ferias-arte-e-diversao-em-canaa-dos-carajas?d=1)[Prefeitura no Pará abre inscrições para concurso](https://dol.com.br/carajas/cidades/sao-felix-do-xingu/884916/prefeitura-no-para-abre-inscricoes-para-concurso?d=1)
O Coronel Batista destacou que o programa traz "ensinamentos importantes a dizer não às drogas, a se defender contra o bullying e a garantir e cuidar da sua intimidade". Ele ressaltou também que o PROERD está contribuindo para "uma geração mais pacífica", com um futuro mais seguro e consciente.
Lavine Lima, estudante de 12 anos, falou sobre sua experiência: "A importância do PROERD foi que podemos ensinar outras pessoas e a nós mesmos como dizer não às drogas de uma maneira mais certa".
A mãe de uma aluna, Débora, também expressou sua gratidão: "Foi muito importante para ela aprender sobre o que é certo e errado, e o mais bonito foi ver a curiosidade dela despertar para saber mais sobre o tema".
Durante a formatura, os alunos ainda participaram de atividades como a premiação das melhores redações, com bicicletas como prêmios, celebrando a dedicação e o aprendizado. O PROERD segue firme no compromisso de oferecer um futuro melhor às próximas gerações.

author: Syndicated Content
title: Explainer-Why was Harvey Weinstein’s rape conviction overturned, and what’s next?
text:
By Brendan Pierson
(Reuters) – Thursday’s ruling overturning Harvey Weinstein’s New York rape conviction gives the one-time film mogul a chance at a new trial and calls into question what evidence prosecutors can use in future sex crime cases.
Here is a look at what happened to the case, which helped define the #MeToo movement, and what might happen next.
WHY WAS WEINSTEIN’S CONVICTION OVERTURNED?
Weinstein, 72, was found guilty of raping one woman and sexually assaulting another after both testified in court.
But a 4-3 majority of the New York Court of Appeals, the state’s highest court, found that the trial judge should not have permitted three other women to testify that Weinstein had assaulted them as well because their allegations were not part of the criminal charges against him.
Such testimony about “prior bad acts” is usually barred by New York’s so-called Molineux rule, named for a landmark 1901 court case. The majority of the court found that the testimony by the three women ran afoul of the rule and made the trial unfair.
WHY WERE THE OTHER WOMEN ALLOWED TO TESTIFY IN THE FIRST PLACE?
The Molineux rule is not absolute. It holds that prosecutors cannot use such testimony to prove that the defendant has a “propensity” to commit crime, but they may use it as evidence of motive or intent.
In Weinstein’s case, prosecutors persuaded the trial judge that the producer’s alleged prior sexual assaults showed that he knew his accusers did not consent to his advances, but that he intended to force them into sex anyway.
Prosecutors believed the evidence would help disprove Weinstein’s assertion that the encounters were consensual.
The Court of Appeals, however, found that the testimony was simply evidence that he had a propensity to commit rape and sexual assault, not of his motive or intent.
WHAT DOES THE RULING MEAN FOR WEINSTEIN’S CALIFORNIA CASE?
Weinstein was sentenced to 16 years in prison following a separate 2022 rape conviction in California, which he is expected to appeal, and the New York ruling has no direct effect on that case.
In fact, California law specifically allows testimony about prior bad acts in sex crime cases as evidence that a defendant has a propensity to commit sex crimes. Such evidence was used in Weinstein’s California trial, and the state’s law will make it harder for his lawyers to challenge on appeal than in New York.
WHAT DOES THE RULING MEAN FOR FUTURE CASES IN NEW YORK?
According to the majority of the court, very little. Judge Jenny Rivera wrote in the majority opinion that the decision was based on well-established New York law, and said it was similar to another 1996 Court of Appeals decision, People v. Vargas, vacating a rape conviction because witnesses were allowed to testify about earlier alleged rapes by the defendant.
Dissenting judges in Thursday’s decision said the ruling would make it more difficult to prosecute sex crimes committed by people who know their victims and may have ongoing relationships with them, as in Weinstein’s case.
Judge Anthony Cannataro, who was among the dissenters, called it “an unfortunate step backwards from recent advances in our understanding of how sex crimes are perpetrated.”
Another dissenting judge, Madeline Singas, said the decision would effectively end the use of prior bad acts witnesses in such cases and make it difficult to prove intent.
(Reporting By Brendan Pierson in New York; Editing by Howard Goller)

author: Lauren Clason
title: Insurers Gaming Surprise Bill Arbitrator Selection, Surgeons Say
text: A New York neurosurgery practice is suing the Biden administration alleging that health plans are abusing the process for selecting an arbitrator when settling disputes over surprise medical bills. The [case](https://www.bloomberglaw.com/public/document/NeurologicalSurgeryPracticeofLongIslandPLLCDocketNo224cv04503EDNY?doc_id=X3BSRVFE7KA9R9RLALN9M1201SO) filed Thursday in New York federal court raises an issue that appears novel in the ongoing legal battles over the enforcement of the 2020 No Surprises Act, which requires medical providers and insurance companies to resolve billing disputes for unexpected out-of-network care, shielding the patient from surprise bills. Other lawsuits have targeted arbitration award enforcement, the cost of filing fees, and other aspects of the arbitration process, which [recent ...](https://news.bloomberglaw.com/daily-labor-report/insurers-still-losing-in-surprise-billing-arbitration-data-show) Learn more about Bloomberg Law or Log In to keep reading: Learn About Bloomberg Law AI-powered legal analytics, workflow tools and premium legal & business news. Already a subscriber? Log in to keep reading or access research tools.

author: Carmen Torres González
title: Estudiantes del ITC obtienen maestría en área de construcción - Noticias de Yucatán
text:
MÉRIDA, Yuc., 5 de diciembre de 2024.- Diecisiete estudiantes del Instituto Tecnológico de la Construcción (ITC) obtuvieron el grado de maestría, tras culminar con éxito sus estudios en las áreas de Administración de la Construcción, Construcción de Vías Terrestres, Gerencia de Proyectos y Valuación Inmobiliaria.
Según se informó en un comunicado, la vicepresidenta de Infraestructura Educativa de la CMIC Yucatán, Wendy Sosa Patrón, destacó que estos nuevos profesionales cuentan con las herramientas necesarias para enfrentar los desafíos del sector y contribuir al crecimiento de la región. “Sus conocimientos y habilidades serán fundamentales para marcar una nueva era en la construcción de Yucatán”, afirmó.
Por su parte, Omar Corzo Olán, representante de la generación, enfatizó el compromiso y esfuerzo de sus compañeros durante los 18 meses de estudio. “Este título representa no solo un logro académico, sino también un testimonio de nuestro compromiso con el país y con el desarrollo de la industria de la construcción”, expresó.
Rosa Isela Pérez Gallardo, egresadas de la maestría en Valuación, resaltó la calidad de los catedráticos y la modalidad en línea de la maestría, que permitió enriquecer el proceso de aprendizaje al interactuar con estudiantes de diferentes partes del país.
El Instituto Tecnológico de la Construcción se consolida como una institución de referencia en la formación de profesionales de la construcción, ofreciendo una amplia gama de maestrías especializadas. En el mes de marzo se aperturan nuevas generaciones en las maestrías ya mencionadas y en Negocios de la Construcción, Mantenimiento de Vías Férreas, Transporte y Almacenamiento de Hidrocarburos, y Eficiencia y Sostenibilidad en Sistemas Energéticos. Para obtener los detalles de inscripción, visita el sitio web icicyucatan.org o llama al 999 925 25 96.
